column4: WTF is wrong with Ubuntu?  Why is it giving me such a hard time?  It just doesn't work.
I've reinstalled this shit way too many times now and I'm losing patience.
It was working fine just this time and then boom.  gnome-settings-daemon cannot start.  WTF is all this?  It doesn't work on a fresh installation.
And this is a brand new /Dell/ laptop which is supposed to run Ubuntu flawlessly.
The GNOME user interface looks pathetic at the moment.
A Dell laptop has given me the /toughest/ time installing Ubuntu on it.

1.  Installing NetworkManager disables my keyboard.   2.  Enabling compiz crashes GNOME   3. I can't install anything using apt because dpkg --configure -a needs to be run.  4. dpkg --configure -a doesn't want to finish successfully with fixing the problem.  So I'm stuck in a rut.
This is the last f time I'm going to try Ubuntu on this laptop.  After that I'll just dump it into the trash can and install Vista back on it.
can you dump the laptop too, i will pick it up :)
It's not mine.  I was helping someone migrate to Linux and now the sword is on my throat.
which ubuntu version you downloaded? did you burn it a low speed?
Yes, I did burn it at low speed, 24 X to be precise.  It's Gutsy Gibbon
low speed is more like 1x or 2x..not anything above that..somehow they fail if burn at higher speeds..as my experience so far
as an option when burning, verify data?
And I'm doing a "Check CD for defects" now
